intro: Rhynchospora schiedeana, commonly known as the Schiede's spike-rush, is a flowering plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with slender, cylindrical stems and small, clustered flowers. Native to tropical and subtropical regions, this plant typically grows in wetlands, marshes, and along the edges of water bodies. Its inflorescence consists of a dense spike of tiny, three-lobed flowers that are often greenish or reddish in color. Rhynchospora schiedeana plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various aquatic and semi-aquatic organisms.
